task.description: Implement ElementWait strategy that waits for a specific element to be present in the DOM using a CSS selector. Useful when you know a specific element indicates page readiness.

acceptance-criteria.criterion: Uses CDP Runtime.evaluate to check element presence
Polls until element found or timeout

implementation-notes.note: Use CDP Runtime.evaluate() to execute JavaScript: document.querySelector(selector) !== null
Poll with interval (default 100ms) until: - Element found: return success - Timeout: throw TimeoutException
Optional: Support waiting for element to be visible (not just present)

testing-requirements.requirement: Unit test with mocked Runtime domain
Integration test with HTML containing delayed element
Test timeout when element never appears
Test immediate success when element already present
